intro: Oenanthe peucedanifolia var. silaifolia, commonly known as the Silaifolia茴香, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
